body:
### Describe the bug

Compilation error:
test.cpp: In function ‘int __pyx_pymod_exec_test(PyObject*)’:
test.cpp:2198:45: error: aggregate ‘__pyx_pymod_exec_test(PyObject*)::__pyx_opt_args_9testclass_testfunc __pyx_t_2’ has incomplete type and cannot be defined
 2198 |   struct __pyx_opt_args_9testclass_testfunc __pyx_t_2;

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
cdef:
	extern from "cpp.cpp":
		cppclass testclass:
			testclass() nogil
			void testfunc(unsigned int a=123) nogil

	
	testclass t = testclass()

t.testfunc(1337)
```

```C++
#include <stdio.h>

class testclass {
public:
	void testfunc(unsigned int a = 123) {
		printf("%d\n", a);
	}
};
```

### Expected behaviour

No compilation errors.

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.11.2

### Cython version

3.0.12

### Additional context

I'm not sure if it's a bug with my compilation script or if this is a Cython bug, but I expect it to be a Cython bug.
Edit: It's not my compilation script, this happens with cythonize as well.

So either this is a bug or a case of lack of documentation on how to define extern cppclass methods with default arguments.
title: [BUG] Extern cppclass with method with default arguments: compilation error
